oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A NEW OSCILLATORY FLOW TUNNEL FOR USE IN SEDIMENT TRANSPORT EXPERIMENTS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: King, David B.
Powell, John D.
Seymour, Richard J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: oscillatory flow tunnel
sediment transport
transport experiment
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The details of a new oscillatory flow tunnel at Scripps Institution of Oceanography are discussed. The flow tunnel has a large crosssection and large water excursion distance. The piston motion is programmable. The test bed can be tilted. These, and other aspects, make the facility useful to a wide variety of oscillatory flow sediment transport experiments.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 19 (1984): Proceedings of 19th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Houston, Texas, 1984.; 106
